definition: to operate (a machine etc) with ease
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
variant of 肏[cao4]
old variant of 操[cao1]
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
as/as if/such as

sentences.english: I was so fond of the plane and able to control it easily in a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这架飞机，不一会儿就能操纵自如了。

definition: as the arm moves the finger (idiom)/freely and effortlessly/to have perfect command of
to have a fluent command of (idiom)
variant of 駕馭|驾驭[jia4 yu4]
to handle matters with ease (idiom)/to hold one's own
commissioner (old)
handling any occasion smoothly (idiom); equal to any situation
to follow one's heart's desires/to do as one pleases (idiom)
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
marvelous/wondrous
lit. to move mountains and drain seas/to transform nature
skillful/proficient
to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
to fly magically through the air
quick/agile/nimble/easy to handle/handy
to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
